doc.summary: The character ; is used to place two statements on a single line.

examples.example: go next card; wait 1 second; go previous card
repeat with x = 1 to 10; doSomething x; end repeat

description.p: Use the ; character to compress code into fewer visible lines for easier reading.
Lines that are split with ; are shown in the script editor as a single line, but when executed, are treated as multiple lines of code. The following line counts as three statements:

p.code: go card 1; beep 2; answer the date

description.p: A ; character which is used within a literal string does not signal a new line, because the ; is treated as part of the string instead of being treated as a line break.
